questions.question: What are the partial pressures of oxygen and carbon dioxide called?
options: Partial pressures of oxygen and carbon dioxide are known as atmospheric pressures.
pO2 and pCO2 are the standard units for measuring gas concentrations.
pO2 and pCO2 are the commonly accepted abbreviations for partial pressures of oxygen and carbon dioxide.
Partial pressures of oxygen and carbon dioxide are referred to as alveolar partial pressures.

questions.question: What are the four main blood types in the ABO blood grouping system?
options: AA, BB, CC, DD
A, B, AB, O
Rh-positive, Rh-negative, Type 1, Type 2
Type Alpha, Type Beta, Type Gamma, Type Delta

questions.question: What are the main components of the excretory system in frogs?
options: Liver, pancreas, intestines, and stomach
Lungs, skin, sweat glands, and salivary glands
Kidneys, ureters, cloaca, and urinary bladder
Brain, spinal cord, heart, and lungs

questions.question: What are choanocytes, and which phylum do they belong to?
options: Choanocytes are muscle cells found in jellyfish (phylum Cnidaria) responsible for locomotion. They lack a collar.
Choanocytes are pigment-containing cells in algae (phylum Protista) that aid in photosynthesis. They have cilia.
Choanocytes are collar cells in sponges (phylum Porifera) that create skeletal structures. They are non-motile.
Choanocytes are nerve cells in worms (phylum Platyhelminthes) that transmit signals. They possess pseudopodia.

questions.question: What are the five major groups discussed under the kingdom Plantae in this chapter?
options: Bacteria, Archaea, Protista, Fungi, Plantae
Bryophytes, Gymnosperms, Angiosperms, Ferns, Mosses
Algae, Fungi, Animals, Bacteria, Viruses
Bryophytes, Pteridophytes, Gymnosperms, Angiosperms, Fungi
